page.title: 14ENGLEFIELD VILLAGE
page.content: Englefield village, which lies near the mansion, is owned by the Estate and includes a Church, village shop and post-office, school, social club and purpose built accommodation for 7 pensioners. There is also a garden centre. All houses within the village are let properties. The older cottages were built using materials and labour from the Estate. Timber and bricks produced on the Estate were used in their construction. Many of the cottages are similar in style and have distinctive brickwork. These were built to house Estate workers, though today some house people who work elsewhere. The most recent buildings are the Estate Pensioners' Flats near the post-office, the additional classroom at the school, and the new vicarage bungalow opposite the school.
